meanings.definition: A person who spurs or urges on
meanings.sent1: The spurrers cheered on the team during the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach and the spurrers motivated the players to do their best.
meanings.sent3: The spurrers play a crucial role in encouraging others to succeed.
meanings.sent4: Like knights of old, the spurrers push their comrades forward in battle.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the wise old spurrers guided the hero on his quest.

meanings.definition: Plural form of spurrer, referring to multiple individuals who spur or urge on
meanings.sent1: The spurrers at the racecourse urged the horses to run faster.
meanings.sent2: After the speech, the spurrers clapped and encouraged the speaker.
meanings.sent3: The spurrers formed a lively group, always motivating each other.
meanings.sent4: The spurrers of progress never tire in their pursuit of excellence.
meanings.sent5: Among the spurrers were the most dedicated supporters of the cause.
